doc.repnme: La micromedicion en el area rural : una experience exitosa en El Salvador
doc.abstracts: In response to the deficiencies in water services delivery in rural areas of El Salvador, the nongovernmental organization - CARE El Salvador - began in 1993 to develop water supply projects, utilizing a payments systems based on water consumption. This field note documents this experience, and illustrates the water metering system used, supported by a strong capacity building of local organizations, for the achievement of an efficient administration. Those projects focused on the establishment of water meters at the micro-level, to control an excessive (non-residential) water consumption, water losses, and inequities in services distribution, among others. The payment systems' process results show improved services, within an autonomous, and financially sound administration, which generates resources, not only to cover operation costs, but those for expanding the system's capacity. Key to success was the community decision for the use of water meters, and the application of water tariffs based on actual consumption.
